meanings.sent1: After the tetanization, the muscle remained contracted for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The tetanization of the muscle caused it to stay rigid.
meanings.sent3: The tetanization of the muscle made it look like a statue.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter caused a tetanization of his facial muscles.
meanings.sent5: The tetanization of the muscle was so intense that it felt like a cramp.

meanings.definition: The process of inducing tetanus in a muscle by repeated electrical stimulation.
meanings.sent1: Doctors used tetanization to study muscle responses to electrical signals.
meanings.sent2: The tetanization procedure involved applying electrical pulses to the muscle.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the tetanization of the muscle made it twitch uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The tetanization process resembled a dance of muscle contractions.
meanings.sent5: The tetanization technique helped researchers understand muscle behavior better.

meanings.definition: The act of causing a sustained contraction of a muscle by rapidly repeating stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The tetanization of the muscle resulted in a continuous contraction.
meanings.sent2: Repeated stimuli led to the tetanization of the muscle.
meanings.sent3: The tetanization of the muscle made it seem like it had a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The tetanization caused the muscle to lock in place.
meanings.sent5: The tetanization made the muscle feel as hard as a rock.
